wikipedia_page.main: John Alexander Smith (21 April 1863 – 19 December 1939) was a British idealist philosopher, who was the Jowett Lecturer of philosophy at Balliol College, Oxford from 1896 to 1910, and Waynflete Professor of Moral and Metaphysical Philosophy, carrying a Fellowship at Magdalen College in the same university, from 1910 to 1936. He was born in Dingwall and died in Oxford.

link_mentions.page: List of Balliol College, Oxford people

response: * John Alexander Smith, On the Soul (1931)
His accomplishments include his work with John Alexander Smith on a 12-volume translation of Aristotle.
*John Alexander Smith (physician) (1818–1883), Scottish physician, antiquarian, archaeologist and ornithologist
